newsitem.title: USA: CoCensys licenses product to American Home.
newsitem.headline: CoCensys licenses product to American Home.

text.p: CoCensys Inc said Tuesday it had licensed its new anxiety treatment product to Wyeth-Ayerst, a unit of American Home Products Corp, in an agreement that could be worth up to $59 million to CoCensys.
CoCensys said Wyeth-Ayerst will fund the development of the product, Co 2-6749, and its backup compounds.
Wyeth-Ayerst will make an up-front licensing payment of $5 million, and American Home Products will purchase $5 million of convertible preferred stock of CoCensys.
The $59 million figure excludes clinical development costs, royalties and profit-sharing for the lead candidate.

Wyeth-Ayerst also will support CoCensys's research to identify back-up compounds and pay CoCensys up to $40 million in milestone payments depending on key development events and the outcome of product labeling, CoCensys said.

CoCensys and Wyeth-Ayerst will co-promote any resulting product in certain market segments in the United States. Wyeth-Ayerst will have rights to any resulting products in the rest of the world, subject to royalty payments.
Co 2-6749 is a synthetic version of a class of compounds called epalons, naturally occurring neuroactive compounds that have a calming role in the brain, CoCensys said.
CoCensys shares were up 1/8 to 4-1/4 in morning trading.
